answers.answer: I'm not sure. But the things that come to mind are a problem with blood sugar, blood pressure or maybe seizure related? I have  a migraine variant that makes me shake and also makes me sick at night. My meds took all that away. I didn't have headaches when I was diagnosed. They did an electroencephalogram (EEG) where they put wires on your head (doesn't hurt). and measure your brain activity. The other other think would be an arrhythmia or heart problem. A lot of times these are benign or no problem but some are. So, you may ask your parents to take you in to check a good checkup.

Your heart is racing so as to pump the blood round your body quicker to get oxygen to the different organs.You may be anaemic where there is not enough red corpuscles due to lack of iron to carry enough oxygen.You may have a problem with your sugar levels and get dehydrated.  Low sugar levels in the body and dehydration can give you the symptoms that you experience.  Make sure that you eat properly, a healthy diet with fresh fruit and vegetables and drink plenty of water.  Eat regularly and do not skip on meals, but do cut out or cut down on junk foods, processed and refined foods like cakes etc., that includes fizzy drinks like cola too.If your blood pressure becomes too high or too low and any neck problems can also make you feel light headed.I would suggest you make any appointment to see your doctor to check your blood for anaemia, diabetes and to check your blood pressure.  Also to check you out for any infections.Best wishes
